body_html:
Update 2:

VS2017 (update 8) compiler 1915 can fix the problem of this issue. The caffe2 code can be compiled in CPU part.

However, 'ATen\native\cuda\SpectralOps.cu' can not be correctly compiled by nvcc (CUDA10). I suspect that this may be the bug of nvcc. Hope nvidia can solve this issue asap. Can some guy @ some people at nvidia part for testing this cu file?

Finnally, I think the best way to use CUDA10 & cuDNN7.3 currently is to use VS compiler, version 1900, (i.e., vs2015, v140).

It works perfect!

Finnally, I think the best way to use CUDA10 & cuDNN7.3 currently is to use VS compiler, version 1900, (i.e., vs2015, v140).
It works perfect!
body:
Update 2:

VS2017 (update 8) compiler 1915 can fix the problem of this issue. The caffe2 code can be compiled in CPU part.

However, 'ATen\native\cuda\SpectralOps.cu' can not be correctly compiled by nvcc (CUDA10). I suspect that this may be the bug of nvcc. Hope nvidia can solve this issue asap. Can some guy @ some people at nvidia part for testing this cu file?

Finnally, I think the best way to use CUDA10 & cuDNN7.3 currently is to use VS compiler, version 1900, (i.e., vs2015, v140).

It works perfect!
